DataPreparation¶

module DataPreparation

Provides function to Clean, Transform and Format data in preparation for the ML.

Functions:
loadDataset

Loads the raw data from a directory.

transform

Transforms texts into features thanks to textual feature extraction technique including bow (tf-idf, count, hashing) and Doc2Dev.

prepareData

Load dataset and extract features to prepare data for ML.

prepareDataIly

Same as prepareData, but specifically on Ilyeum contract dataset.

preparationReport

Provides a textual report of the complete preparation process.

Authors

Nathan Ramoly

Module Contents¶

DataPreparation.loadDataset(datadir='C:\Users\Nara\Workspace\datasets\Contrats\aggDataset')¶

loadDataset

Generates two dictionnaries describing segments from a directory of a dataset containing raw data and annotation. .. todo:: Handle default directory pass.

Parameters

datadir – directory of the dataset to load.

(segId, text) (segId, label) :return: Dictionnary associating segment to text (segId, text) :rtype: dict(int, str) :return: Dictionnary associating segment to label/annotation (segId, label) :rtype: dict(int, str)

cleanSegments

Clean all segments using the DataCleaning module.

Parameters

segments (dict(int, str)) – Raw segments of text.

Returns

Clean segments.

Return type

dict(int, str)

DataPreparation.convertLabels(labels, classes, binary=False, refClass=None)¶

convertLabels

Convert the string label to numerical one. Binary = if different than one class refClass = list of reference classes

Parameters

  • labels (dict(str, str)) – Dictionnary of raw annotation to convert per segment id.

  • classes (list(str)) – List of all known classes in the domain.

  • Binary – Convert label into 1 and 0 values, 1 meaning the label

matches the reference class, 0 otherwise. The reference classes are provided or, by default, is the first class in the ‘classes’ array. :type Binary: bool

Parameters

refClass – Reference classes that are to be converted, while the

other ones are ignored. :type refClass: list(str)

Returns

Set of label/class as numerical values.

Return type

dict(str, int)

Returns

Mapping between textual and numerical labels.

Return type

dict(str, int)

DataPreparation.transform(segments, labels, transformer='count', oversample=False, trasnformSerial='Models\vectorizer.pickle')¶

transform

Transform a set of textual segments into features. It offer multiple feature extraction techniques and can oversample the data set classicaly or geneticaly (see TextGeneticOversampler module).

Parameters

  • segments (list(str)) – Raw segments of text.

  • labels – List of raw annotation associated to each segment.

  • transformer (str) – Feature extraction tool to use: - ‘count’ or ‘bow’ (default): standard BOW using sklearn.CountVectorizer. - ‘tfidf’ or ‘tf-idf’: TF-IDF feature extraction through sklearn.TfidfVectorizer. - ‘hash’: Uses sklearn.HashingVectorizer - ‘doc2vec’: DL doc2vec approach provided by Gensim.

  • oversample (bool) – Assert if oversample should be performed or not.

  • trasnformSerial (str (filepath)) – Transform process export path.

Returns

Set of data of training (x_train)

Return type

np.array

Returns

Set of label of training (y_train)

Return type

np.array

Returns

Set of data of testing (x_test)

Return type

np.array

Returns

Set of label of testing (y_test)

Return type

np.array

DataPreparation.transformBOW(segments, labels, segments_test=None, labels_test=None, serialPath='Models\vectorizer.pickle')¶

transformBOW

Apply feature extraction with sklearn.CountVectorizer. It relies on char_wb and an ngram range of [4,5]. .. todo:: Adapt parameter in the AutoML process

Parameters

  • segments (np.array) – Raw segments of text.

  • labels (np.array) – List of raw annotation associated to each segment.

  • serialPath (str (filepath)) – Transform process export path.

  • segments_test (np.array) – Test segments to transform.

  • labels_test (np.array) – List of labels on the test set.

Returns

Set of data of training (x_train)

Return type

np.array

Returns

Set of label of training (y_train)

Return type

np.array

Returns

Set of data of testing (x_test)

Return type

np.array

Returns

Set of label of testing (y_test)

Return type

np.array

DataPreparation.transformDoc2Vec(segments, labels, segments_test=None, labels_test=None)¶

transformDoc2Vec

Apply feature extraction with gensim.Doc2Vec. Be aware that this process is heavy.

Parameters

  • segments (np.array) – Raw segments of text.

  • labels (np.array) – List of raw annotation associated to each segment.

  • segments_test (np.array) – Test segments to transform.

  • labels_test (np.array) – List of labels on the test set.

DataPreparation.oversampling(X, Y, random=0)¶

oversampling

Oversample datasets (already transformed) The resulting size of each class set is almost equal.

Parameters

  • X (np.array) – Data to oversample.

  • Y (np.array) – Labels associated to the data.

DataPreparation.classFilter(segments, labels, classes)¶

classFilter

Filter the dataset with only selected classes.

Parameters

  • segments (dict(int, str)) – Segments of text to filter.

  • labels (dict(str, str)) – Dictionnary of raw annotation to convert per segment id.

  • classes (list(str)) – List of all accepted class.

Returns

Filtered set of segments of text.

Return type

dict(int, str)

Returns

Filtered labels.

Return type
